candidates.title: feat(model): remove `tracing`
candidates.body: The `tracing` ecosystem of crates allow for recording events which can then be viewed when debugging. Most `twilight` crates therefore record useful data with it, but its unnecessary for `twilight-model` to do so. This is because deserializers most necessary data on deserialization error for troubleshooting. Including further details is left to dependants. `twilight-gateway`, for example, includes the full gateway event in `ReceiveMessageError`.

candidates.title: build(gateway, http): Allow simd-json 0.10

labels.name: t-build
labels.description: Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies

candidates.body: Again, API compatible for our use.

candidates.title: build: bump MSRV to 1.67

labels.name: c-all
labels.description: Affects all crates or the project as a whole

labels.name: t-build
labels.description: Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies

candidates.body:
Bumps the MSRV from 1.64 to 1.67.

Utilizes `let else` statements whereever possible.

1.67 was chosen as it's the current stable - 2, which is not too recent but not too old. Specifically, it was necessary to bump the MSRV as our dependencies (in this case `time`) have a policy of supporting stable - 6 months (currently 1.65).

candidates.title: build(gateway, http): Allow simd-json 0.8 and 0.9

labels.name: t-build
labels.description: Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies

candidates.body: These versions seem to be API compatible with 0.7 (for our usage)

candidates.title: build(gateway, http, lavalink): Dependency updates for rustls 0.21

labels.name: t-build
labels.description: Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies

candidates.body: PR goes to next because it is not advisable to have two different versions of `rustls` in the dependency tree and we shouldn't force it upon users in a patch release.

candidates.title: refactor(model, cache, gateway)!: update bitflags crate to v2
candidates.body: Updates bitflags to `2`. Bitflags crate changes: https://github.com/bitflags/bitflags/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#whats-changed-5

candidates.title: feat(http-ratelimiting)!: hide `http` dependency
candidates.body:
The `http` crate was exposed in `Method` for `twilight-http` to use when sending requests. Hyper (the underlying HTTP crate), however, accepts string representations of HTTP methods too, so this PR switches to using that instead.

Closes #1456

candidates.title: docs(gateway): remove simple examples
candidates.body: These examples are so simple that they don't serve a point
